business.headline: SBI shares gain 1% to hit 52-week high. Should you buy?SBI shares have seen an uptick in the past few days. This has been a reaction to the country's largest lender completing the sale of a part of its stake in YES Bank.

Sensex falls 300 points, Nifty below 25,100 as profit booking continuesAt 9:22 am, the S&P BSE Sensex declined 309 points to 81,792.86, and the NSE Nifty50 slipped 100 points to 25,069.45. Broader market indices also witnessed early losses, led by persistent selling pressure.

Epack Prefab, BMW Ventures, Jain Resource IPOs open today: Where should you bet?Three IPOs will open for bidding today. Epack Prefab Technologies, BMW Ventures, and Jain Resource Recycling begin their public subscriptions today.

What is silver SIP and is it better than gold this festive season?With gold already at peak levels, many investors are asking whether silver, especially through systematic investment plans (SIPs) in exchange traded funds (ETFs), could be a smarter choice this festive season.
GST buying bonanza kicks off, cars lead the wayPM Narendra Modi described GST 2.0 as "a reform dedicated to the people of India," and for many, the benefits were felt immediately.

Is your income tax refund less than Rs 10,000? Here's why it might reach you fasterMany taxpayers are frustrated with refund delays. But here's the catch, simpler refunds tend to move more quickly through the system than bigger claims.

Festive season stock picks: Which sectors are the best bet right now?Autos have already seen a sharp rally, while consumer durables, FMCG, PSU banks, and infrastructure are also emerging as areas to watch.

Sensex and Nifty end flat as IT losses offset consumer stock gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 11.83 points to 82,102.1, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 32.85 points lower at 25,169.50. The broader small- and mid-cap indices also lagged, declining 0.5% and 0.4%, respectively.

Indian-origin Srinivas Gopalan, Rahul Goyal appointed as CEOs of two big US companiesTwo major US companies have appointed Indian-origin CEOs. Telecom giant T-Mobile announced Srinivasan Gopalan will take over as CEO from November 1. Beverage major Molson Coors has chosen Rahul Goyal as its new CEO, effective October 1. Gopalan's appointment comes as the US wireless market faces challenges, including slowing subscriber growth and fierce competition. Goyal, a company veteran, has previously served in key roles including CFO of Molson Coors India. These appointments are notable amidst discussions around the H1B visa program in the US. A reporter noted, "Desi CEO for US Giants is the biggest news in the day for Telecom and IT space as well." This highlights the significance of these leadership changes in the corporate world.

Gold rises to all-time high. 3 reasons behind its strengthInvestors are flocking to gold as it climbs to record highs, supported by currency weakness, economic uncertainty, and inflationary pressures. Here are the three main drivers.

Denied, delayed, dismissed: Inside India's broken health insurance systemIn this special report, part of our 'CLAIM DENIED' series, we uncover why health insurance in India has become a gamble for families, as rising premiums, delayed settlements, and weak accountability leave them vulnerable when they need support most.

SIP vs SWP: How to turn your retirement corpus into reliable incomeAccumulating wealth through SIPs is just the beginning of retirement planning. The real challenge is turning that corpus into a steady income. Here's how you can do it.

entertainment.headline: KJ Yesudas honoured with MS Subbulakshmi award, Sai Pallavi, Anirudh get KalaimamaniThe Tamil Nadu government announced the Kalaimamani and MS Subbulakshmi awards for the year 2021, 2022 and 2023. Sai Pallavi, SJ Suryah, Anirudh Ravichander and several others have been bestowed with Kalaimamani, highest civilian honour by the government.

SRK fixes Rani's hair, saree at National Awards, fans call it Rahul-Tina momentShah Rukh Khan and Rani Mukerji received National Awards in New Delhi for their films 'Jawan' and 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway'. Amid all the viral videos from the ceremony, a clip of SRK helping Rani with her hair and saree has caught the attention of all.

Alia Bhatt, in a fur coat, makes striking appearance at Milan Fashion Week. PicsActor Alia Bhatt made a striking appearance at Milan Fashion Week 2025. She dazzled in a fur coat and stockings. Bhatt also spoke about her upcoming film, 'Alpha'.

SRK's struggle to wear National Award medal goes viral. Rani-Vikrant come to rescueShah Rukh Khan struggled to wear his medal at the 71st National Film Awards 2025. The cute moment was captured on video and quickly went viral among fans online.

How Pawan Singh's participation in Rise & Fall was a missed opportunityBhojpuri actor Pawan Singh's exit from 'Rise & Fall' was announced by the show's host Ashneer Grover on Sunday. Despite being called 'TRP king' by his fans, his stint on the reality show was far from impressive. Here's why.

This silver is gold: Suhana, Aryan's sweet note for papa SRK's National Award winSuhana Khan and Aryan Khan posted a sweet message for their father Shah Rukh Khan after he received the National Film Award for Best Actor for 'Jawan'.

Actor Suriya's security officer duped of Rs 42 lakh by his domestic help's familyActor Suriya's PSO was cheated of Rs 42 lakh by his domestic help's family. The scam has wider implications as police uncover a Rs 2 crore fraud racket in Chennai.

Real fear is within: Vidhu Vinod Chopra on 12th Fail's National Award winDirector Vidhu Vinod Chopra's film '12th Fail', depicting Manoj Kumar Sharma's inspiring rise from poverty to the IPS, won a National Award in New Delhi. The filmmaker, in an exclusive interview with AajTak, emphasised that his cinema is about truth and inner conviction, hoping audiences engage deeply with his work.

Poonam Pandey removed from Mandodari role in Delhi Ramlila amid objectionsThe Luv Kush Ramlila Committee has removed actor Poonam Pandey from playing Mandodari at Delhi's Red Fort after facing objections from political and religious groups. The committee said the decision was made to ensure the event's core purpose of spreading Lord Ram's message is upheld.

Rani Mukerji wears necklace with daughter Adira's initials at National Awards. PicRani Mukerji won the Best Actress award at the 71st National Film Awards for 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway' and added a personal touch to her look with a gold chain featuring her daughter Adira's initials.

Exclusive: Homebound Oscar selection sparks rule debate, FFI chairman responds'Homebound' has been selected as India's official entry for the Oscars 2026. The decision sparked debate over the film's theatrical release and screening timeline compliance.

Janaawar OTT: When and where to watch Bhuvan Arora's crime seriesBhuvan Arora leads 'Janaawar – The Beast Within', a gritty crime drama about a tribal sub-inspector drawn into a dangerous investigation of murder, greed, and betrayal. The series premieres on ZEE5 on September 26, following the trailer launch on September 8.

Allu Arjun heaps praise on Teja Sajja's Mirai, calls it technical brillianceTeja Sajja's 'Mirai' has emerged as a box-office success, earning praise from industry mains including Allu Arjun, for its passion, scale, and technical excellence. With global collections crossing Rs 100 crore and continuous fan support, the film is set to enjoy a strong theatrical run ahead.

Cinema is the heartbeat of my soul: Mohanlal after Dadasaheb Phalke winMohanlal accepted the Dadasaheb Phalke Award at the 71st National Awards with a stirring speech, calling the honour "not a dream-come-true but something sacred," and dedicating it to Malayalam cinema and its legendary fore-runners.

When Katrina Kaif reflected on childhood and her hopes as a future motherKatrina Kaif shared her thoughts on fatherhood, the absence of a father figure during her upbringing, and her hopes for her future children. The actor and her husband Vicky Kaushal are expecting their first child.

Aryan Khan nails star power in The Ba***ds of Bollywood with no wasted cameosAryan Khan's directorial debut with 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' shines with 21 Bollywood cameos, sharp storytelling, and a vision that proves he's more than just Shah Rukh Khan's son.

KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan recalls time when wife Jaya played host on the showOn 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', Big B shared Navratri greetings and welcomed contestant Pallavi Niphadkar. Bachchan recalled an episode where his wife Jaya hosted, and he became the contestant, describing himself as speechless.

Mastiii 4 teaser: OG trio Vivek, Riteish, Aftab promise four times laughter and funThe teaser of 'Mastiii 4' starring Vivek Oberoi, Aftab Shivdasani and Riteish Deshmukh is out. The film is slated to release in theatres on November 21.

Parineeti Chopra back on YouTube with baby bump and life updates. WatchActor Parineeti Chopra on Tuesday announced her YouTube comeback eight months after starting her channel. The latest video featured the actor exploring different ideas and genres for her channel and reacting to viral memes, while giving a baby bump update.

general news.headline: Quad summit on horizon after 'encouraging' India-US trade talks in New YorkIndia and US trade talks in New York show fresh momentum after tariff setbacks. Sources say discussions are constructive, with the possibility of a Quad summit before year's end.

Bombing own people: India mocks Pak at UN over Khyber Pakhtunkhwa strikesIndian diplomat Kshitij Tyagi slammed Pakistan at UNHRC, accusing it of exporting terror, illegally occupying J&K, and "bombing their own people", after deadly airstrikes killed civilians in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

True bunch of losers: Trump slams ABC for bringing back Jimmy Kimmel's showIn a fiery Truth Social post, Donald Trump chided both Jimmy Kimmel and ABC, accusong the latter of putting itself in "jeopardy" by bringing the late-night show back.

Melania, Trump step on escalator, it stops. Fuming White House demands probeA stalled UN escalator carrying President Trump and First Lady Melania sparked White House outrage, with Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt demanding an investigation amid suspicions staff intentionally triggered the mishap.

Pakistan is in bed with both China and US. Will it turn into a battlefield?China's "iron-brother" Pakistan's warm embrace of Donald Trump's US, from deals on cryptocurrency, minerals, to nominating him for the Nobel Peace Prize, has made the Chinese wary of Islamabad's calculated posture. China, which has poured billions into Pakistan through the CPEC projects, sees this as a double game. Pakistan might emerge as the next flashpoint in the US-China rivalry, warn experts.

Not one call: Shashi Tharoor slams diaspora over silence on India-US setbacksCongress MP Shashi Tharoor urged Indian-Americans to push US lawmakers on India policy, noting diaspora silence on H-1B fees, tariffs, and trade issues as a Democratic delegation reaffirmed bipartisan support for ties.

Skilled Indians welcome in Germany, says envoy after US's H-1B visa shake-upIn a subtle jab at the Trump administration's abrupt overhaul of the H-1B visa system, Dr Philipp Ackermann, German Ambassador to India, highlighted Germany's stable and rewarding immigration policies.

Kolkata reels from record rain in 40 years, more in store as Durga Puja nearsThe wet spell that submerged Kolkata on Monday and Tuesday is expected to persist till September 25, clouding the run-up to Durga Puja.

SRK's struggle to wear National Award medal goes viral. Rani-Vikrant come to rescueShah Rukh Khan struggled to wear his medal at the 71st National Film Awards 2025. The cute moment was captured on video and quickly went viral among fans online.

Congress's historic CWC meet in Bihar, hopes for Telangana-like poll successParty president Mallikarjun Kharge, senior leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, as well as nearly 170 members of the committee are set to attend the historic meeting in Patna, seen as a bid to replicate the Congress's success in the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections.
ULIPs & Mutual Funds: Why you need both for a balanced portfolioULIPs give you protection and discipline for the long haul, while mutual funds give you liquidity and flexibility for the near term.

Watch: Indonesia President signs off UN General Assembly speech with Om ShantiThe Indonesian President concluded his 19-minute speech at the 80th UN General Assembly with the Sanskrit mantra "Om Shanti, Shanti Om", invoking a message of harmony amid global uncertainties.

India predicted XI for Super 4 clash vs Bangladesh: Will Jasprit Bumrah be rested?Asia Cup, India vs Bangladesh Super 4 predicted XI: During the opening round, India experimented with their line-up only once their place in the Super Four had been secured. Now, with the business end of the tournament approaching, the management are expected to retain the same combination for the clash against Bangladesh.

US govt proposes new H-1B visa system, favours high-skilled, high-waged workersThe Trump administration's H-1B visa overhaul, prioritising high-skilled, well-paid workers, follows a hefty $100,000 fee hike. Aimed at curbing the visa programme's alleged misuse, the move has sparked a debate about whether it would really protect American jobs or drive talent abroad.

Video: UP headmaster under probe for assault thrashes education officer with beltBrijendra Verma, the headmaster of a primary school in Sitapur district, was under enquiry for allegedly harassing an assistant teacher from the same school.

Karnataka CM to Azim Premji: Lend me a road, I've a traffic problem to solveKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah wrote to Wipro founder Azim Premji to allow limited vehicular movement through the campus, aiming to ease traffic on Bengaluru's Outer Ring Road.

Alia Bhatt, in a fur coat, makes striking appearance at Milan Fashion Week. PicsActor Alia Bhatt made a striking appearance at Milan Fashion Week 2025. She dazzled in a fur coat and stockings. Bhatt also spoke about her upcoming film, 'Alpha'.

Trump and Epstein statue appears on National Mall sparking controversyThe 12-foot artwork depicts Trump and Epstein smiling at each other while standing on one leg, holding hands, and seemingly walking toward the Washington Monument.

Trump can win Nobel only if...: Macron on US President's ambitions after UN addressEmmanuel Macron said that Donald Trump could only win the Nobel Peace Prize if he ends the Gaza conflict, stressing that only Washington has the leverage to pressure Israel. Macron also warned France is prepared for possible Israeli retaliation over its recognition of a Palestinian state.

Shreyas Iyer requests break from red-ball cricket ahead of West Indies Tests: ReportShreyas Iyer has reportedly requested a break from red-ball cricket, writing to the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) to ask that he not be considered for Test matches for the time being, according to news agency PTI.

How Pawan Singh's participation in Rise & Fall was a missed opportunityBhojpuri actor Pawan Singh's exit from 'Rise & Fall' was announced by the show's host Ashneer Grover on Sunday. Despite being called 'TRP king' by his fans, his stint on the reality show was far from impressive. Here's why.

What is silver SIP and is it better than gold this festive season?With gold already at peak levels, many investors are asking whether silver, especially through systematic investment plans (SIPs) in exchange traded funds (ETFs), could be a smarter choice this festive season.

He is putting one hell of a fight: Trump praises Zelenskyy during New York meetThis marked the fourth meeting between the two leaders since Trump returned to office in January. Their discussions come as tensions rise between Nato and Moscow following a string of Russian aerial incursions into allied airspace.

Bulldozer verdict gave immense satisfaction: Chief Justice BR GavaiThe ruling, delivered last year by a bench of Justices BR Gavai and KV Viswanathan, condemned the practice of arbitrary demolitions as it delivered a verdict on petitions challenging bulldozer action.

sports.headline: Asia Cup 2025: Why India should be wary of underdogs Bangladesh in Super 4 clashAsia Cup 2025: India enter the Super 4 clash as clear favourites, but Bangladesh's history of upsets - from the 2007 World Cup to consecutive bilateral wins in 2015 and nail-biting finishes in Asia Cup finals - proves they can make even the giants sweat.

Bangladesh should perform well vs India, they deserve better: Chopra on Super 4 clashBangladesh's resurgence in the Asia Cup 2025 sets up a fascinating Super 4 showdown against unbeaten India. With Aakash Chopra and coach Phil Simmons backing them, Litton Das's men enter the clash with renewed confidence and passionate support.

Did another Pakistan bowler, Nashra Sandhu copy Haris Rauf's 6-0 gesture: ExplainedPakistan spinner Nashra Sandhu celebrated her six-wicket haul and 100th ODI wicket with a six-finger gesture. The pose has sparked debate about whether it was a celebratory act or a political statement amid India-Pakistan tensions.

Asia Cup Super 4: India, a win away from final berth, face upbeat BangladeshAsia Cup IND vs BAN, Super 4 preview: The numbers are heavily in favour of India, but Suryakumar Yadav and his men are likely to face their sternest test of the tournament on Wednesday. Bangladesh, on the back of a morale-boosting win against Sri Lanka, will be keen on testing themselves against the best team in the world. Can Litton Das and his men produce an upset?

Pakistan not at the same level as India, feel bad for them sometimes: Ishant SharmaIndia's dominance over Pakistan in the Asia Cup has reignited debates around the once-iconic rivalry. Ishant Sharma's remarks highlight how Pakistan's players buckle under fan pressure, unlike their past stars, raising questions about the current team's competitiveness.

India predicted XI for Super 4 clash vs Bangladesh: Will Jasprit Bumrah be rested?Asia Cup, India vs Bangladesh Super 4 predicted XI: During the opening round, India experimented with their line-up only once their place in the Super Four had been secured. Now, with the business end of the tournament approaching, the management are expected to retain the same combination for the clash against Bangladesh.

Super 4 Qualification Scenario: Pakistan breathe back life in race for finalPakistan's five-wicket win over Sri Lanka has blown the Asia Cup 2025 Super 4 race wide open, leaving India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka in a tight battle for the spots in the final.

Hussain Talat eyes title after PAK beat SL: Two matches, trophy is oursPakistan all-rounder Hussain Talat hailed his team's five-wicket win over Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup Super Four, emphasising that players are regaining form and aiming for the title.

Pakistan bounce back to hammer Sri Lanka, stay alive in final raceAsia Cup 2025: Pakistan overcame Sri Lanka in a tense and nervy chase to secure valuable points in the Super Four stage of the Asia Cup. After a disciplined bowling show, Pakistan chased down a 133-run target in just 18 overs in Dubai on Tuesday, September 23.

ICC suspends USA cricket body over governance issuesThe International Cricket Council has suspended USA Cricket membership citing governance failures and reputational damage. The ICC will oversee US teams and guide reforms to protect cricket's future in the country.

After war of celebrations, Hasaranga hugs it out with Pakistan's Abrar AhmedWanindu Hasaranga and Abrar Ahmed lit up the Asia Cup 2025 Super 4 clash on Tuesday with a playful duel of wickets and imitations, turning a tense low-scoring game into box-office theatre.

No rest in Asia Cup, Jasprit Bumrah likely to be picked for West Indies TestsAsia Cup 2025: On the eve of India's Super Four match against Bangladesh in Dubai, assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate hinted that Jasprit Bumrah will be included in the Test squad for the upcoming two-match series against the West Indies, starting on 2 October in Ahmedabad.

Shreyas Iyer requests break from red-ball cricket ahead of West Indies Tests: ReportShreyas Iyer has reportedly requested a break from red-ball cricket, writing to the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) to ask that he not be considered for Test matches for the time being, according to news agency PTI.

Watch: Pakistan's Abrar Ahmed gives Wanindu Hasaranga a dose of own medicineAsia Cup 2025, PAK vs SL: Pakistan spinner Abrar Ahmed added a fun twist to the Super 4 clash against Sri Lanka by imitating Wanindu Hasaranga's signature celebration after dismissing him.

Delighted how India carried themselves despite Pakistan provocation: Assistant coachAsia Cup 2025: India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate praised the players' composure for not reacting to provocative gestures from Pakistan players during their heated Super 4 match. The former Dutch captain also shed light on Jasprit Bumrah's performances and Sanju Samson's show in the tournament.

Sanju Samson gets backing from team management despite tough start to new roleAsia Cup 2025: Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said the team management is backing Sanju Samson to find his rhythm in the middle-order. Samson struggled to get going against Pakistan in the Super 4 match in Dubai on Sunday.

England announce Ashes squad: Harry Brook named vice-captain, Mark Wood returnsBen Stokes, Mark Wood and Jofra Archer have been named in England's Ashes squad as they continue their injury comebacks, while Chris Woakes misses out ahead of the November series in Australia.

Saw what Haris Rauf did: India coach responds to fighter-jet gesture controversyIndia assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate praises the team's calm response to Haris Rauf's provocative gestures during Asia Cup 2025. India beat Pakistan by six wickets in the Super 4 fixture of the tournament in Dubai.

How India destroyed Pakistan in sign-language warIndia's dominance over mujahid mentality-infested Pakistan spans both the battlefield and cricket field. It has turned Pakistani provocations into opportunities to assert control. From Operation Sindoor to Arshdeep Singh's viral on-field gesture, India's evidence-backed strikes and measured retorts on the field have left Pakistan outplayed in every arena.

Samson struggled to get going against Pakistan in the Super 4 match in Dubai on Sunday.

It has turned Pakistani provocations into opportunities to assert control. From Operation Sindoor to Arshdeep Singh's viral on-field gesture, India's evidence-backed strikes and measured retorts on the field have left Pakistan outplayed in every arena.

Bangladesh going to ride on the hype of playing against India: Coach Phil SimmonsAsia Cup 2025, IND vs BAN: After their close shave against Sri Lanka, Bangladesh will look to continue their form when they lock horns with Suryakumar Yadav's India on Wednesday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Litton Das suffers injury scare before Bangladesh's Super 4 clash vs IndiaBangladesh suffered a scare ahead of their Super Four clash against India as skipper Litton Das injured his left rib during practice in Dubai. If ruled out, Parvez Hossain Emon could replace him in the XI.

IND-A vs AUS-A: Expensive spells from Siraj and Krishna help Australia reach 350Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna registered expensive figures during Day 1 of the second unofficial Test as Australia A ended at 350-9 against India A. However, Manav Suthar registered his fifth five-wicket haul in first-class cricket.

Harbhajan Singh slams Shaheen, Haris after Pakistan's Asia Cup loss to IndiaFormer India spinner Harbhajan Singh has questioned the leadership and performance of Pakistan's senior bowlers, Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf, after their Asia Cup defeat to India, where the Indian openers dominated despite heated verbal exchanges.

Legendary umpire Dickie Bird, who stood in 1983 World Cup final, dies at 92Legendary umpire Dickie Bird died at the age of 92. His ability to command respect while maintaining warmth and humour made him one of the most popular officials in the game.

Tilak Varma treated Shaheen Afridi like a net-ball spinner: Sunil GavaskarTilak Varma scored an unbeaten 30* off 19 balls vs Pakistan, smashing two fours and as many sixes in his innings. He smashed Afridi for a six followed by a boundary to finish the match in style.

Lionel Messi-led Argentina likely to face Australia in Kerala friendly this NovemberLionel Messi-led Argentina is likely to play a friendly match against Australia in Kerala this November. The visit is expected to boost local football enthusiasm and includes a multi-city tour across India.

Smriti Mandhana achieves career-best ICC ODI ratings, Deepti Sharma jumps to 5thSmriti Mandhana reached a career-best rating of 818 to consolidate her position at the top of the ICC Women's ODI batting rankings, while Deepti Sharma rose to fifth among bowlers after her consistent performances against Australia.

Asia Cup: Arshdeep Singh's response to Haris Rauf's fighter-jet celebration goes viralIndia's Arshdeep Singh made headlines with a fiery gesture which could likely have come during the game against Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025.

India fined for maintaining slow over rate in high-scoring 3rd ODI vs AustraliaThe Indian women's cricket team was fined for a slow over rate in their third ODI against Australia. Despite Smriti Mandhana's record-breaking century, India lost the match and the series 2-1 ahead of the Women's World Cup 2025.

How gaming led to Man United's success under Sir Alex Ferguson? Wayne Rooney revealsWayne Rooney revealed video games on the team bus helped boost Manchester United's communication. This off-field bonding played a surprising role in the club's success under Sir Alex Ferguson.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
